definition: imperious/peremptory
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
harsh and unreasonable/unexpected

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent

sentences.english: But I like the arrogant, imperious, imposing, self-willed I.
sentences.chinese: 不過我喜歡高傲，專橫，威風，任性的自己。

sentences.english: His peremptory tone of voice irritated everybody.
sentences.chinese: 他那專橫的語氣激怒了大家。

sentences.english: Some investors have been scared off by nationalisations and arbitrary regulation.
sentences.chinese: 一些投資者被國有化和專橫通知嚇怕了。

sentences.english: His peremptory tone of voice irritated everybody .
sentences.chinese: 他那專橫的口氣激怒了大家。

sentences.english: The arbitrary police action provoked the public.
sentences.chinese: 警察的專橫行爲激起了公憤。

sentences.english: In the meanwhile, they also point out and criticize Qianlong's arbitrary decisions and peremptory actions.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，他們也指斥了乾隆的專橫獨斷等行爲。

sentences.english: Being bossy is out and teamwork is in.
sentences.chinese: 專橫已然過時，團隊合作纔是正理。

sentences.english: It was rather high-handed of him to take that decision without consulting others first.
sentences.chinese: 他太專橫，沒有和大家商量就做出了那個決定。

sentences.english: Untold millions of believers have served him faithfully under despotic governments.
sentences.chinese: 數不清的信徒是在暴虐專橫的政府之下忠心地服事主。

sentences.english: He domineered, and the rest of us hated it.
sentences.chinese: 他行事專橫，我們大家都討厭他這一套。

sentences.english: He tried to domineer over everyone.
sentences.chinese: 他想對任何人都專橫跋扈。

sentences.english: Dumb computer is obviously bossy too.
sentences.chinese: 不會說話的計算機明顯也是專橫的。

sentences.english: Progressive leaders, however, are not supposed to be dictatorial .
sentences.chinese: 進步的領導者，然而，不應該是專橫的。

sentences.english: Tears conquer the face of the bossy head nurse.
sentences.chinese: 專橫的護士長臉上滑落點點淚珠。

sentences.english: To make art was to achieve a tyrannous freedom from self-explanation.
sentences.chinese: 爲了使藝術從自我表達中達到一個專橫的自由。
我不喜歡他那幅專橫的態度。

definition: lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
temperamental/moody
feudalism
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
rude and unreasonable
to decide alone without consultation/arbitrary/dictatorial
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
stupid and ignorant (idiom)
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
traitor
fight to the death/desperate struggle
druggist
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
